channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Reds intensifying disinformation on anti-terror bill – Lacson
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Fronts of the New People’s Army have intensified their disinformation campaign against the proposed Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020 even as more communist rebels have surrendered ahead of the expected proscription of the rebel group once the measure is enacted into law, according to Sen. Panfilo Lacson.

item.title: Go wants greater benefits for single parents
item.description: Sen. Bong Go yesterday renewed his call for the passage of a bill that aims to provide additional benefits and privileges to 14 million solo parents in the country, helping them ease the burden of single-handedly raising their children.

item.title: More BPO job openings seen
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: More jobs in the business process outsourcing firms are set to open in the coming months for Filipinos in Metro Manila and other areas in the country, according to the Department of Labor and Employment.

item.title: Lawmaker to DOH: Reject flawed, costly COVID-19 tests
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: An official of the House of Representatives yesterday called for a comprehensive review of the accuracy of all brands of coronavirus disease 2019 tests being used by the Department of Health and licensed laboratories across the country.

item.title: US willing to share COVID vaccine with allies
item.author: Michael Punongbayan
item.description: The United States has expressed willingness to share a vaccine against the coronavirus disease 2019 with its allies and partners once it is available.

item.title: ‘Balik Probinsya’ to return – Palace
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The “Balik Probinsya, Balik Pag-Asa” program will resume after the government has assisted the people stranded in Metro Manila, according to Malacañang.

item.title: Online masses not enough, bishop says
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: While masses have been celebrated online, virtual is not enough for Catholics who have been deprived of the Holy Eucharist which they receive only when physically present at church, Archdiocese of Manila apostolic administrator Bishop Broderick Pabillo said.

item.title: DOST pilot-testing contact tracing app
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: The Department of Science and Technology has developed a contact tracing app for coronavirus disease 2019 positive and suspected cases.

item.title: DOLE: OFWs needing aid top 500,000
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: Over half a million overseas Filipino workers affected by the coronavirus disease 2019 or COVID-19 pandemic are seeking financial aid, the Department of Labor and Employment reported.

item.title: Give online sellers financial assistance – Robredo
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Instead of taxing micro online sellers, the government should provide them with financial assistance to help them survive the adverse impacts of the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic, Vice President Leni Robredo said yesterday.
